refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GdvAxis is the base class of all single-dimensional axes. It is an container for the affiliated tics and indicators. The exact appearance of the axis is delegated to inherited class-definittions. However the implemented geometry handling can be used for any axis, that is a basically a straight line.

refsect2.title: CSS nodes
refsect2.para: GdvAxis uses a single CSS node with name axis.

refsect2.title: gdv_axis_get_tic_for_value ()
refsect2.para: Returns a GdvTic assigned to the axis with given value.

This function should be used carefully. It is usual difficult to use due to problems with the precision of Tic-valus and rounding-issues. Most of the time it will be a better solution to use gdv_axis_get_tic_list() and compare the tic-values to a specific precision-criteria.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GdvTic with the given Tic-value.

refsect2.title: gdv_axis_title_set_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets the text of the title. If markup is NULL, the current title is removed.

entry.para: the text to use as the title of the axis.

refsect2.title: gdv_axis_get_title ()
refsect2.para: If the axis’ title widget is a GtkLabel, returns the text in the label widget. (The frame will have a GtkLabel for the title widget if a non-NULL argument was passed to gtk_frame_new().)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the text in the title, or NULL if there was no title widget or the lable widget was not a GtkLabel. This string is owned by GTK+ and must not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: gdv_axis_queue_value_interval ()
refsect2.para: The function compares the value against the scale-begin and -end. If the value is outside the axis range, the axis scale-beg-val or scale-end-val will be adjusted to the value.
This function is in particular usefull to update an axis for new values.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the point is oudside the range of the layer-axes and FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: The “axis-beg-at-screen-x” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value origin point of the axis relative to the layer-area.

refsect2.title: The “axis-beg-at-screen-y” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value origin point of the axis relative to the layer-area.

refsect2.title: The “axis-beg-pix-x” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value origin point of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “axis-beg-pix-y” property
refsect2.para: Determines the y-value origin point of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “axis-direction-outside” property
refsect2.para: The angle of orientation of the outside of the axis relative to the top.

refsect2.title: The “axis-end-at-screen-x” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value end point of the axis relative to the layer-area.

refsect2.title: The “axis-end-at-screen-y” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value end point of the axis relative to the layer-area.

refsect2.title: The “axis-end-pix-x” property
refsect2.para: Determines the x-value end point of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “axis-end-pix-y” property
refsect2.para: Determines the y-value end point of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “axis-orientation” property
refsect2.para: angle between the beginning of the axis and the vertical on screen.

refsect2.title: The “force-beg-end” property
refsect2.para: This property forces the axis to use the manually assigned beg- and end- properties. This property should be used with care because it may lead to a bad geometry-handling. However, in some cases one wants to bind the axis-geomety to the geometry of a layer or underlying other widget.
This might be usefull e.g. when painting an axis above a picture or live-stream.

refsect2.title: The “mtics” property
refsect2.para: sets the absolute number of mtics per scale interval.

refsect2.title: The “mtics-automatic” property
refsect2.para: Determines whether mtics should be setted automatically.

refsect2.title: The “mtics-beg-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the beginning value of mtics-settings.

refsect2.title: The “mtics-end-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the end value of mtics-settings.

refsect2.title: The “scale-auto-increment” property
refsect2.para: Determines whether the increment-value should be determined automatically.

refsect2.title: The “scale-beg-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the minimum value of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “scale-end-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the maximum value of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “scale-increment-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the increment value of the axis.

refsect2.title: The “scale-limits-automatic” property
refsect2.para: Determines whether if the scale-borders should be rounded automatically up to the next better value.

An annotation about the behaviour of GdvAxis:scale-limits-automatic: The property does not implie, that there should be absolutely no changes to the values of GdvAxis:tics-beg-val and GdvAxis:tics-end-val. It just means, that the GdvAxis:scale-beg-val and GdvAxis:scale-end-val should kept constant!

refsect2.title: The “tics-automatic” property
refsect2.para: Determines whether tics should be setted automatically.

refsect2.title: The “tics-beg-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the beginning value of tics-settings.

refsect2.title: The “tics-end-val” property
refsect2.para: Determines the end value of tics-settings.

refsect2.title: The “title-widget” property
refsect2.para: The title widget of the axis.
